17D8D6697F314BA3A64FD5F83B7B6000.description: Explain how warranties and insurance can safeguard identity, money, and property.

716607289932447FAD26FAD3A4B2DB2D.description: List ways individuals can safeguard their person information and protect against identity theft.

1208CFBCE725469883434B6C198A83A1.description: Safeguards exist that help protect one’s identity.

7147BB578CE740A881D5C160BFDF1886.description:
Rick Management and Insurance: As individuals accumulate net worth and establish a standard of living, they assume the risk of loss of income and assets. Use of a 
risk management plan mitigates the potential loss of income and personal net worth and safeguards personal identity. Risk management products and strategies change over one’s life span.

67CE5B8881F24113957AC611C472EEB0.description: Research the advantages and limitations of various career opportunities.

889E600E459F4E928807262E7052109D.description: Describe the difference between grant, loan, and scholarship.

2792EA2C893D43CDA283B4AEF31002B3.description: Many options exist for paying for post-secondary education opportunities.

1E700A35622E4F25B5F2AFE85841DBED.description: Explain the consequences of paying the minimum payment when making a monthly credit card payment.

300E4F3CC000479C84D99410B2E6ABCC.description: Evaluate several credit card offers and choose the best card based on criteria such as interest rate, late fees, rewards programs and annual fees.

6D98DCEEC8DB4DA6A7DEC2E581ADA716.description: Financial documents and contractual obligations inform the consumer and define the terms and conditions of establishing credit and incurring debt.

2724689AC5E44A1190A1DB25D5E91EA5.description: Discuss situations that positively or negatively impact an individual's credit score.

570CBB8EF8F44EEBB315465B1E965E38.description: Effectively balancing credit and debt helps one achieve some short- and long-term goals.

5D1E7FCC5A274CC99B1E2B7319B23B37.description: Discuss the impact debt may have on individuals and families.

9A9C9F1B93D74E18BD3974F1AB71B581.description: Debt is an obligation owed by one party to a second party.

90DABA96021A4D0CA040F0947FDAC580.description: Identify the terms that may exist within a loan.

69E0740917E646D39255BB385483897F.description: Describe the difference between a loan from a bank and one from a payday lender.

B72CA445298F4422AE710B717AEA2DBA.description: Credit is a contractual agreement in which a borrower receives something of value now and agrees to repay to lender at some later date.

91B67FB551AA4B629BF4CF64A00685CB.description: Credit and Debt: Responsible use of credit is one tool to help achieve financial and lifestyle goals. To advance successfully through financial life stages, a consumer must create, establish and maintain credit worthiness. Disciplined consumers borrow within their means at favorable terms and repay debt responsibly.

9627ACC77C7A4946906B1842E0855793.description: Describe the roles of government agencies and protections they offer to investors.

A44449B6A6C24A728B1475146B968B00.description: Government agencies are charged with regulating providers of financial services to help protect investors.

AC63EF036653467CAAFD80A123635039.description: Compare the administrative costs (fees) and taxes of various investment products.

6145F61B0594443E81E9A5FEC722AD42.description: Demonstrate how compound interest affects an investment at 10, 20, 30, and 40 years.

A5E7467C5D334BACBA10FFD289F6E785.description: Investment strategies must take several factors into consideration such as compounding interest, costs, fees, tax implications, and the time value of money.

9A52DBB451D04A8983BE841ACD2A324F.description: Discuss factors that an impact the value of investments.

FCA4476A7A604C89A4D0A7D66980B88D.description: Describe ways to increase net worth.

36981AB16DAA4A5B9F00AA8ECDD82ADB.description: Identify different types of liabilities and assets.

576E5D1CAC2D429185257CC7DD3483F5.description: Using key investing principles, one can achieve the goal of increasing net worth.

05CC48E5E33A4B34B381ADDD31BF194F.description: Investing: The goal of financial management is to increase one’s net worth. Investing, through a variety of options, is one way to build wealth and increase financial security. Many factors affect investment and retirement plans. Among the many examples are government regulations and global economic and environmental conditions.

3F287A56093D4E50BB357B497771D352.description: Compute sales tax on comparable items in different tax localities.

CCD7F3A78BC04E9B9A850AF3015D6ED6.description: Compare the overall costs of goods and services from various distributors, such as retail and online.

F0BADB9E1E6846F1830E49FF42AB56E2.description: Identify the difference between direct and indirect costs.

153B1D0022254C0C9AC70B1D2E4EE073.description: Planned purchasing decisions factor in direct (price) and indirect costs (e.g. sales/use tax, excise tax, shipping, handling, and delivery charges, etc.).

9F9C06C3F3454EE78A1B21500FF47CF0.description: Review a bank statement and a credit card statement to become familiar with transaction postings.

A87951DCC8114A449577B9195379DD4B.description: Explain how protection laws may shield individuals from fraud and potential loss.

41F8CDCB05C74F7981665B5808329626.description: Consumer protections laws help safeguard individuals from fraud and potential loss.

32853996021C49AF98F95EFCF7B6F6B7.description: Compare the terms and conditions of the consumer-lending statements from two or more financial institutions to determine which one is better for a given consumer.

A81629960A8348499F4459AD73C5B7B6.description: Compare bank terms before opening an account.

8A3062DBAB554B57A2F32746A64798E5.description: Describe consumer protections provided to citizens through government and consumer agencies.

898BF4323B2F46DCAC70E1737F7B246E.description: Explain actions consumers can take if they believe they have been victims of fraud.

0C19ADCE2A664652927FDBF40572FDFE.description: Identify ways consumers can identify fraud and protect themselves from becoming a victim of fraud.

F48186AE6EAF470FA353141E2484BE00.description: Consumer advocates, organizations and regulations provide important information and help protect against potential consumer fraud.

107E799BDA674BE085F7744ACDC626FF.description: Explain how advertising may impact a consumer's decision when making a purchase.

6A0D840293D84D718776A0E53F72B72F.description: Explain the factors a consumer considers before making a purchase

A6C57AFA5D344E35A53718F1C17DB939.description: An informed consumer makes decisions on purchases that may include a decision-making strategy to determine if purchases are within their budget.

0FC9F61FBA934C588B1DF256E851C289.description: Informed Consumer: Informed purchasing decisions are essential for responsible financial management. Limited protections against some consumer fraud exist in government regulatory agencies and laws. Ultimately, consumers must be informed and vigilant when making purchasing decisions.

78DFA87CF2DD42EE82766C888DB5215B.description: Calculate the impact of taxes on an individual's income and spending.

33F57201234B4B55BB41713B2E93DB51.description: Identify how tax money is used to benefit individuals and communities.

A0A99E117BDD4C7B88C5FEA4677167A9.description: Planning for and paying local, state, and federal taxes is a financial responsibility.

E686E4EC7A3F440F81B6C4478C608D9C.description: Describe the role and responsibilities of a financial expert.

C197AB79B8C04C808B15A84463F81DE6.description: Financial experts provide guidance and advice on a wide variety of financial issues.

D199BB3D6EDF4923BC73F5976994FAFC.description: Reconcile checking and savings account balance using both an account register and an electronic tool.

EDAB8DD358034028BC1B0FEBCAA03DE0.description: Evaluate products and services from financial institutions that a student might use, such as checking and savings accounts, and discuss advantages and disadvantages of different products.

E57BECDC874F4599AD7DA68503561A47.description: Financial institutions offer a variety of products and services to address financial responsibility.

224CE029CDED4634B8BA27B7F022C402.description: Prepare a monthly budget for a family or individual with consideration to income, savings goals and taxes, as well as fixed and variable expenses.

33F74C7420A649E1928B7629F2FF5606.description: Identify factors that could force an individual to change his or her budget.

C32742DF37B94887B6F9AE63786E91D9.description: Devise a spending and savings plan (budget) for current short- and long-term goals, income, and expenses.

756C30268FAF4A3281D52FA7565332B5.description: People should revise their budgets to prepare for unplanned changes in income. A budget should include short-term savings or emergency funds to pay for unexpected expenses, such as a car repair, as well as long-term savings that reflect larger goals, such as a down payment on a house or retirement.

29FAE228484A4981920751B33E1F6A91.description: S.M.A.R.T. (Specific, Measurable, Attainable, Realistic, Time-bound) goals help individuals determine and remember what their financial goals should reflect.

71AF258D0908494EA2E57DB618694CC5.description: To achieve short- and long-term financial goals, a spending and savings plan (budget) must be created, evaluated and updated on a regular basis. Income and expenses must be accurately reflected for the budget to be a useful tool.

9392D2E7E5F145B0862B643B5AE21050.description: Financial responsibility includes the development of a spending and savings plan (personal budget).

9A12F2C536B9451FAF978589D320F56A.description: Planning and Money Management: A disciplined personal financial plan is a critical component of financial success. Financial institutions and professionals provide services, expertise and guidance for developing and implementing one’s financial plan.

A3027848EDBB4F01B0DD309ABBAC0C01.description: Identify the difference between voluntary and involuntary deductions.

3122F5575C9E4B2692E5372327FB2D8E.description: Understand the effect of deductions and withholdings on gross pay.

603009ED498E4B818CDB84ECF52C20D0.description: List common deductions, such as insurance, taxes, and retirement.

98965BD434274222971D0695205FD87B.description: Taxes, retirement, insurance, employment benefits, and both voluntary and involuntary deductions impact take-home pay.

000664AB6A634E279AF8D8B84D1A15A6.description: Explain the causes that affect income changes in specific jobs.

B4543FE0376149AD926EC55DA046132F.description: List and explain the different types of income, including earned and unearned.

B2A1E30B8766498FB3743261F89E65B5.description: Income sources include job earnings and benefits, entrepreneurship, saving and investment earnings, government payments, grants, inheritances, etc. Workers can experience dramatic income dips and spikes from month to month.

85715E3F2D55400D9C863012FB8ED831.description: Explain how one can become more employable through training and education.

356A1B590CE143958DC8203641940872.description: Evaluate individual interests and skill sets to identify potential careers.

F7E8D27DB4B44354B3D189AF998333F7.description: Identify how various training and education options in high school and beyond can further one's employability.

12D943BE39B1464D9AD0F26976AB8B87.description: Competencies (knowledge and skills), commitment (motivation and enthusiasm), competition (globalization and automation), training, work ethic, abilities and attitude are all factors impacting one’s earning potential and employability.

FE5AF8A8BC1A48C2A5EB0EC36662A415.description: Understand there are positive and negative consequences for financial decisions.

012A73BA83C74B74B827F42ACC24AE20.description: Explore how education and career decisions affect incomes and job opportunities.

5F63706524604885AD2A74EABE768A0B.description: List financial decisions made at different stages of life and factors that will affect those decisions.

C7D7E46003E34CEAA5570102631C4C76.description: Financial responsibility involves lifelong decision-making strategies which include consideration of alternatives and consequences.

F985B5932D22409C99338A80BD5D6897.description: Describe responsible ways to manage money.

9EB6B21D381C42A5987A6A678041FF6C.description: Identify the differences between short- and long-term financial goals.

B8C7DCF2800F42888A517C006955C182.description: Financial responsibility entails being accountable for managing money to satisfy one’s current and future economic choices.

13D0AEA1B41144EAB0043FB84C47F03D.description: Financial Responsibility and Decision-Making: In the United States’ economy, personal financial decisions rest with the individual. Making responsible decisions related to goals for lifestyle and financial wants fosters financial success and security.
